inclusion.criterion: Pelvic pain of at least 3 months duration
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: Diagnosis of endometriosis by laparoscopy or laparotomy within three years of entry
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: The diagnosis of endometriosis will require either histology consistent with endometriosis or operative records indicating visual evidence of lesions consistent with endometriosis
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Moderate to severe pelvic pain preoperatively attributable to endometriosis (average Numerical Rating Scale of 5 or more for three or more months)
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: Willingness to comply with visit schedule and protocol
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Use of oral contraceptives within one month of the surgery
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Dose of Lupron within three months if given monthly or within five months if given 3-month injection
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Any disorder that represents a contraindication to the use of oral contraceptives (e.g. insulin-dependent diabetes mellitus, history of thrombophlebitis, hypertension, history of cardiovascular disease, smoker at 35 or more years of age) or GnRH analogs (e.g., history of osteopenia)
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: History of hysterectomy and bilateral salpingoophorectomy
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Positive pregnancy test at first postoperative (i.e, intake visit)
exclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Significant mental or chronic systemic illness that might confound pain assessment or the inability to complete the study
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: Patient is a 19-year-old Hispanic female with mild headache and leg swelling. She has hypertension (BP of 146/99) and proteinuria (3+ proteins on urine dipstick).
